page.title: 10 ROYAL BRITISH LEGION
page.content: The Royal British Legion Village is a small housing estate for ex-service people, in the centre of the Kent countryside at Aylesford. There are shops and a community centre there.They also have industries for the people of the Estate and for many disabled people. The Royal British Legion Village was made after the First World War. When the British Legion came to Preston Hall Hospital in 1925 they built the Village for the chest patients to work in. In the village is also a poppy appeal office and warehouse where all the poppies are stored for Remembrance Day. by Stuart Hosking
